original_title: Sri Lanka rupee at 299.50/300.00 to dollar at open, bond yields steady
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened at 299.50 /300.00 against the US dollar in the spot market on Friday, while bond yields were steady, dealers said.
The  rupee closed at 302.00 /40 to the US dollar on Thursday after opening around 302.80/303.10 rupees.

Sri Lanka’s rupee is under upward pressure due to negative private credit as not all inflows turn into credit and imports. The central bank has bought dollars to boost reserves, and the liquidity created has reduced overnight cash shortages.
A bond maturing on 01.09.2027 was quoted at 26.50/70 percent steady from Wednesday’s close at 26.55/65 percent.
